name: AHC HRSN Screening
title: AHC HRSN Screening
publisher: Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services

code.display: AHC HRSN Screening Core Questions

item.text: AHC HRSN Screening Core Questions

code.display: Living Situation

item.text: Living Situation

code.display: What is your living situation today?

item.text: What is your living situation today?

valueCoding.display: I have a steady place to live
I have a place to live today, but I am worried about losing it in the future

I do not have a steady place to live (I am temporarily staying with others, in a hotel, in a shelter, living outside on the street, on a beach, in a car, abandoned building, bus or train station, or in a park)

code.display: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following?

item.text: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following?

valueCoding.display: Pests such as bugs, ants, or mice
Smoke detectors missing or not working

item.text: CHOOSE ALL THAT APPLY

code.display: Food

item.text: Food

code.display: Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.

item.text: Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.

code.display: Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.

item.text: Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.
Some people have made the following statements about their food situation. Please answer whether the statements were OFTEN, SOMETIMES, or NEVER true for you and your household in the last 12 months.

code.display: Transportation

item.text: Transportation

code.display: In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings, work or from getting things needed for daily living?

item.text: In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings, work or from getting things needed for daily living?

code.display: Utilities

item.text: Utilities

code.display: In the past 12 months has the electric, gas, oil, or water company threatened to shut off services in your home?

item.text: In the past 12 months has the electric, gas, oil, or water company threatened to shut off services in your home?

code.display: Safety

item.text: Safety

code.display: How often does anyone, including family and friends, physically hurt you?

item.text: How often does anyone, including family and friends, physically hurt you?

code.display: How often does anyone, including family and friends, insult or talk down to you?

item.text: How often does anyone, including family and friends, insult or talk down to you?

code.display: How often does anyone, including family and friends, threaten you with harm?

item.text: How often does anyone, including family and friends, threaten you with harm?

code.display: How often does anyone, including family and friends, scream or curse at you?

item.text: How often does anyone, including family and friends, scream or curse at you?

code.display: Safety score

item.text: Safety score
A score of 11 or more when the numerical values for answers to questions 7-10 are added shows that the person might not be safe.

Because violence and abuse happens to a lot of people and affects their health we are asking the following questions. A score of 11 or more when the numerical values for answers to the questions are added shows that the person might not be safe.
If someone chooses the asterisk (*) answers, they might have an unmet health-related social need.

code.display: AHC HRSN Screening Supplemental Questions

item.text: AHC HRSN Screening Supplemental Questions

code.display: Financial Strain

item.text: Financial Strain

code.display: How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating? Would you say it is:

item.text: How hard is it for you to pay for the very basics like food, housing, medical care, and heating? Would you say it is:

code.display: Employment

item.text: Employment

code.display: Do you want help finding or keeping work or a job?

item.text: Do you want help finding or keeping work or a job?

valueCoding.display: I do not need or want help

code.display: Family and Community Support

item.text: Family and Community Support

code.display: If for any reason you need help with day-to-day activities such as bathing, preparing meals, shopping, managing finances, etc., do you get the help you need?

item.text: If for any reason you need help with day-to-day activities such as bathing, preparing meals, shopping, managing finances, etc., do you get the help you need?

valueCoding.display: I get all the help I need
I could use a little more help
I need a lot more help

code.display: How often do you feel lonely or isolated from those around you?

item.text: How often do you feel lonely or isolated from those around you?

code.display: Education

item.text: Education

code.display: Do you speak a language other than English at home?

item.text: Do you speak a language other than English at home?

code.display: Do you want help with school or training? For example, starting or completing job training or getting a high school diploma, GED or equivalent.

item.text: Do you want help with school or training? For example, starting or completing job training or getting a high school diploma, GED or equivalent.

code.display: Physical Activity

item.text: Physical Activity

code.display: In the last 30 days, other than the activities you did for work, on average, how many days per week did you engage in moderate exercise (like walking fast, running, jogging, dancing, swimming, biking, or other similar activities)?

item.text: In the last 30 days, other than the activities you did for work, on average, how many days per week did you engage in moderate exercise (like walking fast, running, jogging, dancing, swimming, biking, or other similar activities)?

code.display: On average, how many minutes did you usually spend exercising at this level on one of those days?

item.text: On average, how many minutes did you usually spend exercising at this level on one of those days?

code.display: Substance Use

item.text: Substance Use

code.display: How many times in the past 12 months have you had 5 or more drinks in a day (males) or 4 or more drinks in a day (females)? One drink is 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, or 1.5 ounces of 80-proof spirits.

item.text: How many times in the past 12 months have you had 5 or more drinks in a day (males) or 4 or more drinks in a day (females)? One drink is 12 ounces of beer, 5 ounces of wine, or 1.5 ounces of 80-proof spirits.

code.display: How many times in the past 12 months have you used tobacco products (like cigarettes, cigars, snuff, chew, electronic cigarettes)?

item.text: How many times in the past 12 months have you used tobacco products (like cigarettes, cigars, snuff, chew, electronic cigarettes)?

code.display: How many times in the past year have you used prescription drugs for non-medical reasons?

item.text: How many times in the past year have you used prescription drugs for non-medical reasons?

code.display: How many times in the past year have you used illegal drugs?

item.text: How many times in the past year have you used illegal drugs?

The next questions relate to your experience with alcohol, cigarettes, and other drugs. Some of the substances are prescribed by a doctor (like pain medications), but only count those if you have taken them for reasons or in doses other than prescribed. One question is about illicit or illegal drug use, but we only ask in order to identify community services that may be available to help you.

code.display: Mental Health

item.text: Mental Health

code.display: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

item.text: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

code.display: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?

item.text: Little interest or pleasure in doing things?

code.display: Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

item.text: Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

code.display: Mental health score

item.text: Mental health score
If you get 3 or more when you add the answers to questions 23a and 23b the person may have a mental health need.

code.display: Stress means a situation in which a person feels tense, restless, nervous, or anxious, or is unable to sleep at night because his or her mind is troubled all the time. Do you feel this kind of stress these days?

item.text: Stress means a situation in which a person feels tense, restless, nervous, or anxious, or is unable to sleep at night because his or her mind is troubled all the time. Do you feel this kind of stress these days?

code.display: Disabilities

item.text: Disabilities

code.display: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions? (5 years old or older)

item.text: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have serious difficulty concentrating, remembering, or making decisions? (5 years old or older)

code.display: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have difficulty doing errands alone such as visiting a doctor's office or shopping? (15 years old or older)

item.text: Because of a physical, mental, or emotional condition, do you have difficulty doing errands alone such as visiting a doctor's office or shopping? (15 years old or older)
If someone chooses the asterisk (*) answers, they might have an unmet health-related social need.
